Posted By: bowlofgumbo (7/6/2012 1:09:06 AM)

posts.post_content:
Very little more fun in my casual GW angels than:  
  
1) Forest -> [Avacyn's Pilgrim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avacyn's Pilgrim)  
2) Plains -> [Harrow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Harrow) for two more plains  
3) Plains -> [Serra Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Angel) / [Shepherd of the Lost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shepherd of the Lost)  
4) Plains -> [Serra Avenger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Avenger) x3  
  
Often followed by a [Goldnight Redeemer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goldnight Redeemer), or possibly a [Deathless Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathless Angel)  
  
  
People forget that low-drops aren't just cards you can play earlier, they're cards you can cast on later turns while keeping mana open for a [Cloudshift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cloudshift), a [Cancel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cancel), a [Titanic Growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Titanic Growth), even.  
  
4/5
posts.html:
Very little more fun in my casual GW angels than:

1) Forest -> Avacyn's Pilgrim
2) Plains -> Harrow for two more plains
3) Plains -> Serra Angel / Shepherd of the Lost
4) Plains -> Serra Avenger x3

Often followed by a Goldnight Redeemer, or possibly a Deathless Angel


People forget that low-drops aren't just cards you can play earlier, they're cards you can cast on later turns while keeping mana open for a Cloudshift, a Cancel, a Titanic Growth, even.

4/5

posts.post_content: I pulled one at the pre-release, and was a staple in my WU creature deck. In epic and flavorful moment, I had an [Serra Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Angel) on the field with a few weenies. My opponent O-rings serra angel and passes the turn, I then play this and I preceded to beat back his assault and eventually break the o-ring and kill him. we both agreed that it was epic.

posts.post_content:
A good card back in the day, but I don't know if she's playable in the current standard. The power creep has *not* been kind to her at all.  
  
I mean, why play a 3/3 flyer with vigilance on turn four when you can get [a 3/2 flyer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=226749) as early as turn two (and attacking on that turn, no less)?
posts.html:
A good card back in the day, but I don't know if she's playable in the current standard. The power creep has not been kind to her at all.

I mean, why play a 3/3 flyer with vigilance on turn four when you can get a 3/2 flyer as early as turn two (and attacking on that turn, no less)?

Posted By: JasonPaul601 (7/12/2012 11:26:17 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card is overrated. It's true, on turn 4 you can put down two of these for 6 damage on turn 4. However, in today's standard she has little to no use and does not replace current turn 4 or even turn 3 cards in standard today.  
  
for example, in a white deck she is going over a slot for [elite inquisitor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=elite inquisitor) or [Thalia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thalia). Which are both much better cards and come out on turn 2 instead of 4. Another problem with this card is that you are spending mana to drop a 3/3 on turn 4 that has nothing useful at that point in the game. She literally is competing for a drop on the same turn as  [sublime archangel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= sublime archangel )  and  [hero of bladehold](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= hero of bladehold).   
  
Maybe 3-4 years ago this card would have been very good, however, today's magic is a game that prints overpowered low-cost cards and games don't go past turn 5 in most situations (notice i said most, the game can and will last beyond that on occasion, but not enough to warrant considering ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
